<document>
<title>Day6</title>
<fragment>

**Day6** (Korean: 데이식스; RR: *De-i-sik-seu*; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean pop rock band under the label JYP Entertainment. The group debuted on September 7, 2015, with the EP *The Day,* which peaked at No.2 on *Billboard*'s World Album Chart a week following its release.[1] The band consists of four members: Sungjin, Young K, Wonpil, and Dowoon. Originally a six-member band, Junhyeok departed on February 27, 2016, and Jae departed on December 31, 2021.[2][3] All of the Day6 members are heavily involved in writing, composing, and producing the band's music.


</fragment>
<fragment>

In 2017, the band released two songs every month of the year for their *Every Day6* project. By the end of the project, 25 songs were added to their discography. With genres ranging from hard rock and upbeat sing-a-longs to mellow ballads. Their first full-length album, *Sunrise,* consisted of songs released in the first half of the *Every Day6* project.[4] It was number 14 on *Billboard*'s *The 25 Greatest K-Pop Albums of the 2010s: Staff List,*[5] and the project kick-off song "I Wait" was placed No.81 on *Billboard*'s *The 100 Greatest K-Pop Songs of the 2010s: Staff List.*[6]




## History

[edit]

### 2014–2016: Formation, debut and further releases

[edit]

See also: The Day (Day6 EP) and Daydream (Day6 EP)

</fragment>
<fragment>

In June 2018, Day6 released their first greatest hits album in Japan, *The Best Day.* Which is composed of the band's previous Korean singles and three new-version tracks: "Congratulations" (English Ver.), "I Wait" (Japanese Ver.), and "You Were Beautiful" (English Ver.). On June 26, Day6 released their third EP *Shoot Me: Youth Part 1*.[35] The EP contains seven tracks, with the lead single titled "Shoot Me". The second part, *Remember Us: Youth Part 2*, was released on December 10 with the lead single "days gone by".[36] On October 17, 2018, between the release of the two parts, their first Japanese studio album *Unlock* was released. Day6 went on their first world tour, titled *Youth*, subsequently performing in 24 cities in Asia, Australia, North America and Europe from June 22, 2018, to January 29, 2019.[37]



### 2019–2021: *The Book of Us* series, second world tour, first sub-unit, and Jae's departure

[edit]

Main article: Even of Day


</fragment>
<fragment>

On February 27, 2016, JYP Entertainment stated that Junhyeok had departed from the band due to personal reasons and terminated his contract with the company.[11] Day6 continued as a five-member band. On March 30, 2016, Day6 released their second EP, *Daydream*, with the lead single "Letting Go".[12][*unreliable source*] On March 31, Day6 made their official stage debut on the music program *M Countdown*, six months after their initial debut. Following the release, the band held their second live concert *Dream* for 2 nights on May 28–29, 2016 at YES24 Live Hall, and one night overseas in Bangkok, Thailand at the Thunder Dome.



### 2017: *Every Day6* project

[edit]

![](image)Day6 at Live & Meet in Taiwan, July 2017
See also: Sunrise (Day6 album) and Moonrise (Day6 album)


</fragment>
<fragment>

In mid-2015, drummer Dowoon joined the line-up, and the band was renamed Day6.[8] Day6 released their debut EP, *The Day*, with the lead single "Congratulations" on September 7, 2015, marking their debut.[9][10] The album charted at No.2 on *Billboard*'s World Album Chart a week following its release. Day6 held their first live concert *D-Day* for 2 nights on November 21–22, 2015 at YES24 MUVhall. Aside from performing songs from their debut album, the band also did multiple covers and played some unreleased materials of theirs. On October 18, 2015, Day6 held their first overseas showcase in Taiwan, which was also their first overseas schedule, at ATT Show Box. On December 5, 2015, Day6 held their first overseas fanmeeting in Singapore at the Marina Bay Sands Convention Centre.


</fragment>
<fragment>

Their third monthly single with the lead single "How Can I Say" and sidetrack "I Would" was released on March 6. They also promoted on the music program *M Countdown* on March 9.[16] Their fourth monthly single consisting of the lead single "I'm Serious" and sidetrack "Say Wow" was released on April 6. They also promoted on *M Countdown* the same day. Their fifth monthly single was released on May 8, with the lead single "Dance Dance" and sidetrack "Man in a Movie".[17]


In June 2017, Day6 released their first full-length album, *Sunrise*, with a total of 14 tracks. It consists of the releases from January to May, the rebooted version of "Letting Go", the final version of "Congratulations",[18][19][*unreliable source*] and two new tracks: "I Smile" (the lead single of the album) and "Lean On Me". Day6 also announced their official fanclub name, "My Day", the same day.[20][21][*unreliable source*]


</fragment>
<fragment>
* Jae (제이) – guitar, vocals, raps
* Junhyeok (준혁) – keyboard, vocals

* Day6 2nd World Tour "Gravity" (2019-2020)


## Awards and nominations

[edit]

<fragment>
In addition, all seven B-side tracks from the album have been charting in the top 100 on Melon, Bugs, and Genie since the album's release.[45][*unreliable source*][46][47] In August 2020, JYP Entertainment announced Day6's first subunit, Even of Day, composed of Young K, Wonpil and Dowoon, which debuted on August 31 with their EP *The Book of Us: Gluon,* which produced the single "Where the Sea Sleeps."[48] Even of Day partook in the first segment of web music show *Secret Atelier* where they released a single, "So, This Is Love," on January 15, 2021, as a result of the show.[49][50] On January 24, Even of Day held their first online concert, Online Party Night: The Arcane Salon.[51]


</fragment>
<fragment>
On December 29, 2016, Day6 announced their upcoming monthly project in 2017 titled *Every Day6*, in which the band would release two songs every month on the sixth along with concerts prior to the song's release, music videos, and 4 fixed V Live broadcasts.[13][*unreliable source*]


Day6 released their first monthly single with the release of lead single "I Wait" and the sidetrack "Goodbye Winter" on January 6, 2017.[14] Their second monthly single was released with the lead single "You Were Beautiful" and the sidetrack "My Day" on February 6.[15]


</fragment>
<fragment>
It was announced in February 26 that Day6 would make a full group comeback in April 2021.[52] On March 8, 2021, Sungjin announced during his a V Live broadcast that he would be enlisting for his mandatory military service on the same day, having already recorded for the upcoming album.[53] Day6 released their seventh extended play *The Book of Us: Negentropy* and its lead single "You Make Me" on April 19; the album marked the final installment of *The Book of Us* series.[54] Due to Sungjin's military enlistment, the group decided that they would not be doing album promotions for *The Book of Us: Negentropy*.[55] On July 5, 2021, Even of Day returned with their second EP, *Right Through Me* and its lead single of the same name.[56] Young K debuted as Day6's second soloist with his first extended play, *Eternal,* on September 6. 
</fragment>
<fragment>
On April 27, 2020, JYP Entertainment announced that Day6 would be releasing a new album titled *The Book of Us: The Demon* on May 11.[43] The day before the album's scheduled release, JYP Entertainment announced that Day6 would be taking a temporary hiatus to focus on their health.[44] Although Day6 is temporarily halting group activities, the band still released their EP *The Book of Us: The Demon* on May 11 at 6 p.m. KST. The lead single "Zombie" debuted at No. 8 on Melon's realtime chart at 7 p.m. KST and rose as high as No. 4 at 1 a.m. KST on May 12. "Zombie" also went up to No. 1 spot after debuting No. 2 in Bugs. 
</fragment>
<fragment>

40. **^** Lee, Chae-yoon (July 1, 2019). [가요 메모] 데이식스, 7월 15일 컴백+2019 월드투어 예고 [[Song Memo] DAY6, comeback on July 15 + notice of 2019 world tour]. *Herald Corp* (in Korean). Retrieved July 1, 2019.[*permanent dead link*]
41. **^** Park, Boram (October 22, 2019). "Day6 returns with 3rd full album 'The Book of Us: Entropy'". *Yonhap News Agency*. Archived from the original on October 28, 2019. Retrieved October 28, 2019.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Their November single consisting of the lead single "All Alone" and sidetrack "Pouring" was released on November 6. On November 28, JYP Entertainment announced the band's first nationwide tour in 2018, Every Day6 Concert Nationwide Tour. The tour started in Busan on January 20–21, Daegu on January 27 and stopped in Daejeon on February 10.[26][27]


On December 6, Day6 official concluded their monthly project with the release of their second full-length album, *Moonrise*. The album contained the previous releases from July to November, the lead single "I Like You", two sidetracks ("Better Better" and "I'll Try"), and the final versions of the B-sides from their debut EP *The Day*.[28]



### 2018: *Youth* series, Japanese debut and first world tour

[edit]

Day6 official announced the recruitment of their first generation fan club from January 5 to 25.[29][*unreliable source*]

11. **^** [인티포털] JYP밴드 데이식스 멤버 준혁 공식 탈퇴 [[Inti Portal] JYP band Day6 member Junhyeok officially resigned]. *인스티즈(instiz, 音思提资)*. November 28, 2022. Archived from the original on July 2, 2017. Retrieved February 27, 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Their July single consisting of the lead single "Hi Hello" and sidetrack "Be Lazy" was released on July 6. Their August single consisting of the lead single "What Can I Do" and sidetrack "Whatever!" was released on August 7.[22] Their September single with the lead single "I Loved You" and sidetrack "I'll Remember" was released on September 6.[23][24] Day6 originally would released their October single on October 7 and later installment to released on September 29, which consists of the lead single "When You Love Someone" and the sidetrack "I Need Somebody". The music videos of their August, September, and October singles were a three-part story about high school friendship and love.


Day6 held their North American meet and greet tour, Day6 Live & Meet in North America 2017, hosted by SubKulture Entertainment. The tour started in Los Angeles on October 20, Austin on October 22, New York on October 24, Detroit on October 27, and stopped in Toronto on October 29.[25][*unreliable source*]

21. **^** K, J. (June 7, 2017). "Day6 Announces Official Fan Club Name After Comeback". *Soompi*. Archived from the original on July 20, 2017. Retrieved June 19, 2017.
22. **^** Day6, 오늘(7일) 8월 프로젝트 가동…해외 진출까지 [Day 6, today (7th) August project operation... to overseas expansion] (in Korean). jtbc News. August 7, 2017. Archived from the original on February 15, 2019. Retrieved August 8, 2017.
23. **^** Choi, Jeong-min (September 1, 2017). 데이식스 제이, 신곡 '아이 러브드 유' 티저 공개텐아시아 [DAY6's Jae, new song 'I Loved You' teaser released TenAsia]. *Ten Asia* (in Korean). Archived from the original on September 2, 2017. Retrieved September 2, 2017.

</fragment>
<fragment>
In addition, all seven B-side tracks from the album have been charting in the top 100 on Melon, Bugs, and Genie since the album's release.[45][*unreliable source*][46][47] In August 2020, JYP Entertainment announced Day6's first subunit, Even of Day, composed of Young K, Wonpil and Dowoon, which debuted on August 31 with their EP *The Book of Us: Gluon,* which produced the single "Where the Sea Sleeps."[48] Even of Day partook in the first segment of web music show *Secret Atelier* where they released a single, "So, This Is Love," on January 15, 2021, as a result of the show.[49][50] On January 24, Even of Day held their first online concert, Online Party Night: The Arcane Salon.[51]


</fragment>
<fragment>
On December 29, 2016, Day6 announced their upcoming monthly project in 2017 titled *Every Day6*, in which the band would release two songs every month on the sixth along with concerts prior to the song's release, music videos, and 4 fixed V Live broadcasts.[13][*unreliable source*]


Day6 released their first monthly single with the release of lead single "I Wait" and the sidetrack "Goodbye Winter" on January 6, 2017.[14] Their second monthly single was released with the lead single "You Were Beautiful" and the sidetrack "My Day" on February 6.[15]


</fragment>
<fragment>
It was announced in February 26 that Day6 would make a full group comeback in April 2021.[52] On March 8, 2021, Sungjin announced during his a V Live broadcast that he would be enlisting for his mandatory military service on the same day, having already recorded for the upcoming album.[53] Day6 released their seventh extended play *The Book of Us: Negentropy* and its lead single "You Make Me" on April 19; the album marked the final installment of *The Book of Us* series.[54] Due to Sungjin's military enlistment, the group decided that they would not be doing album promotions for *The Book of Us: Negentropy*.[55] On July 5, 2021, Even of Day returned with their second EP, *Right Through Me* and its lead single of the same name.[56] Young K debuted as Day6's second soloist with his first extended play, *Eternal,* on September 6. 
</fragment>
<fragment>
On April 27, 2020, JYP Entertainment announced that Day6 would be releasing a new album titled *The Book of Us: The Demon* on May 11.[43] The day before the album's scheduled release, JYP Entertainment announced that Day6 would be taking a temporary hiatus to focus on their health.[44] Although Day6 is temporarily halting group activities, the band still released their EP *The Book of Us: The Demon* on May 11 at 6 p.m. KST. The lead single "Zombie" debuted at No. 8 on Melon's realtime chart at 7 p.m. KST and rose as high as No. 4 at 1 a.m. KST on May 12. "Zombie" also went up to No. 1 spot after debuting No. 2 in Bugs. 
</fragment>
<fragment>
39. **^** Day6, 데뷔 첫 음방 1위..."팬들과 함께 쓴 한 페이지, 소중히 간직할 것" 뭉클 소감 [Day6, the first music win since debut..."A page written with fans, I will treasure it"]. *Herald Corporation* (in Korean). July 25, 2019. Archived from the original on January 13, 2023. Retrieved July 25, 2019.
40. **^** Lee, Chae-yoon (July 1, 2019). [가요 메모] 데이식스, 7월 15일 컴백+2019 월드투어 예고 [[Song Memo] DAY6, comeback on July 15 + notice of 2019 world tour]. *Herald Corp* (in Korean). Retrieved July 1, 2019.[*permanent dead link*]
41. **^** Park, Boram (October 22, 2019). "Day6 returns with 3rd full album 'The Book of Us: Entropy'". *Yonhap News Agency*. Archived from the original on October 28, 2019. Retrieved October 28, 2019.
42. **^** Day6 、2nd BEST ALBUM「THE BEST DAY2」が12/4発売決定! [Day6, 2nd BEST ALBUM *THE BEST DAY2* 12/4 Release Confirmed!]. *Utaten* (in Japanese). October 8, 2019. Archived from the original on June 22, 2020. Retrieved June 21, 2020.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Their November single consisting of the lead single "All Alone" and sidetrack "Pouring" was released on November 6. On November 28, JYP Entertainment announced the band's first nationwide tour in 2018, Every Day6 Concert Nationwide Tour. The tour started in Busan on January 20–21, Daegu on January 27 and stopped in Daejeon on February 10.[26][27]


On December 6, Day6 official concluded their monthly project with the release of their second full-length album, *Moonrise*. The album contained the previous releases from July to November, the lead single "I Like You", two sidetracks ("Better Better" and "I'll Try"), and the final versions of the B-sides from their debut EP *The Day*.[28]



### 2018: *Youth* series, Japanese debut and first world tour

[edit]

Day6 official announced the recruitment of their first generation fan club from January 5 to 25.[29][*unreliable source*]


</fragment>
<fragment>
10. **^** Lee, Jae-hyun. JYP, 첫 남성 밴드 '데이식스'…데뷔 앨범 '더 데이' [JYP's first male band 'Day6'... Debut album 'The Day']. *NEWSIS*. Archived from the original on July 3, 2017. Retrieved September 4, 2015.
11. **^** [인티포털] JYP밴드 데이식스 멤버 준혁 공식 탈퇴 [[Inti Portal] JYP band Day6 member Junhyeok officially resigned]. *인스티즈(instiz, 音思提资)*. November 28, 2022. Archived from the original on July 2, 2017. Retrieved February 27, 2016.
12. **^** "Day6 Is "Letting Go" and Rocking Out in Comeback MV - Soompi". *www.soompi.com*. March 29, 2016. Archived from the original on June 12, 2018. Retrieved August 6, 2016.
13. **^** KpopStarz (January 3, 2017). "Day6 release teaser images for 'Every Day6 January'". *KpopStarz*. Archived from the original on September 15, 2018. Retrieved April 10, 2017.
14. **^** Day6, 2017 JYP 첫 컴백주자…오는 6일 신곡발표 [Day6, 2017 JYP's first comeback runner... New song released on the 6th] (in Korean). joy news. January 2, 2017. Archived from the original on January 3, 2017. Retrieved January 2, 2017.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Their July single consisting of the lead single "Hi Hello" and sidetrack "Be Lazy" was released on July 6. Their August single consisting of the lead single "What Can I Do" and sidetrack "Whatever!" was released on August 7.[22] Their September single with the lead single "I Loved You" and sidetrack "I'll Remember" was released on September 6.[23][24] Day6 originally would released their October single on October 7 and later installment to released on September 29, which consists of the lead single "When You Love Someone" and the sidetrack "I Need Somebody". The music videos of their August, September, and October singles were a three-part story about high school friendship and love.


Day6 held their North American meet and greet tour, Day6 Live & Meet in North America 2017, hosted by SubKulture Entertainment. The tour started in Los Angeles on October 20, Austin on October 22, New York on October 24, Detroit on October 27, and stopped in Toronto on October 29.[25][*unreliable source*]


</fragment>
<fragment>
15. **^** Day6, 2월 프로젝트송 6일 발표…이별감성 '예뻤어' [Day6, February project song released on the 6th... Separation feeling 'You Were Beautiful'] (in Korean). JTBC News. January 31, 2017. Archived from the original on February 3, 2017. Retrieved February 2, 2017.
16. **^** Mnet K-POP (March 9, 2017), *[Day6 – How Can I Say] Comeback Stage | M COUNTDOWN 170309 EP.514*, archived from the original on April 10, 2017, retrieved April 10, 2017
17. **^** "신나게 놀아보자" 데이식스, 5월 신곡 '댄스 댄스' 공개 ["Let's have fun" DAY6 releases new song 'Dance Dance' in May]. *naver* (in Korean). May 8, 2017. Archived from the original on February 15, 2019. Retrieved May 20, 2017.
18. **^** Day6, 첫 정규앨범 발매 소식과 함께 티저 이미지 공개 '팬들 환호' [Day6 releases teaser image with news of first full album release 'fans cheer']. *Daily Korea* (in Korean). May 30, 2017. Archived from the original on August 8, 2017. Retrieved May 30, 2017.

</fragment>
